# Arpeggio: Major 7th in E

An arpeggio is the sounding of the individual notes of a chord in a sequential manner. The Major 7th arpeggio in the key of E consists of the notes: E, G#, B, and D#.

This arpeggio can add a jazzy and sophisticated sound to your playing, as the Major 7th chord is known for its smooth and rich quality. It can create a dreamy and introspective atmosphere in your music.

## Genre and Musical Flavor

The Major 7th arpeggio is often used in jazz, soul, and R&B genres. It is frequently employed in ballads, smooth jazz tunes, and soulful compositions. The arpeggio adds a sense of elegance and depth to the music, providing a lush and velvety texture to the overall sound.

## Songs That Utilize Major 7th Arpeggio in E

1. **"Georgia on My Mind" by Ray Charles**: This classic soulful ballad features the Major 7th arpeggio in E during the instrumental sections, enhancing the emotional depth of the song.

2. **"All of Me" by John Legend**: This modern R&B hit incorporates the Major 7th arpeggio in E in the piano accompaniment, contributing to the smooth and romantic vibe of the track.

3. **"So What" by Miles Davis**: This iconic jazz piece prominently showcases the Major 7th arpeggio in E in the improvisational solos, adding a sophisticated and cool flavor to the composition. 

These songs demonstrate the versatile and expressive nature of the Major 7th arpeggio in E and how it can enhance different musical styles with its unique charm.
